term.name: atheism
term.source: A privative term derived from Greek theos: god.
term.def: Atheism is an active disbelief in the existence of gods, deities, and supernatural powers; in this respect it is similar to &secularism; and opposed to any variety of &theism;. Atheism is to be contrasted with &agnosticism;, which takes a skeptical attitude toward the existence of gods but does not proclaim disbelief. Although atheistic doctrines are most notorious in their more militant (really anti-theistic) forms, other philosophies instead take the existence or role of gods to be irrelevant in human life and ethics and thus could be termed nontheistic (examples include &epicureanism; and the Samkhya school of &hinduism;). Popularly, atheism is often taken to imply a lack of any ideals or values whatsoever (nearly equivalent to &immoralism;), but this connotation rests on an assumption that religion is the only foundation for values (thus ignoring the possibility of ethical &naturalism;).
